reference_summary:
The Big Year
Steve Martin  (Actor),     Jack Black  (Actor),     David Frankel  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles
['Product Description', 'Steve Martin, Jack Black and Owen Wilson star in this smart, funny comedy from the director of THE DEVIL WEARS PRADA and MARLEY & ME. Looking to shake up their routine lives, three amateur bird watchers compete to become the ultimate "birder" by spotting the greatest number of species within a single calendar year. But the friendly rivalry soon turns into a hilariously complicated cross-country adventure as each man begins to realize that the quest for success comes at a price and that\'s not chicken feed!', 'Amazon.com', 'Never get between a birder and a Pink-footed Goose. As we learn from', 'The Big Year', ', the intensity of birders (the term', 'birdwatcher', "is dismissed here as insufficiently committed) is not to be taken lightly, and their quest of rare species creates the gentle comedy of this film, which is based on a real phenomenon. In the world of birders, there's a goal set each calendar year, and based on the honor system: who can spot the most varieties of our feathered friends? All-time champ Kenny Bostick (Owen Wilson) is a legendary name in the birding game, and this year he's trying to beat his own record--but retired CEO Stu Preissler (Steve Martin) and slovenly upstart Brad Harris (Jack Black) are determined to topple the colorful and ruthless Bostick from his, er, perch. The movie's at its best when charting the movements of these obsessed enthusiasts in the wild, as they scramble from Alaska to Arizona to New Jersey in pursuit of their goal; it's less successful at trying to create human interest in the home lives of these guys. And despite the comedic talents of the main threesome, nobody really stands out; each plays to his usual persona without adding a new wrinkle. Director David Frankel (", 'The Devil Wears Prada', ") has a weirdly overqualified supporting cast on his hands, but except for Rosamund Pike as Bostick's neglected wife and Rashida Jones as a geeky birder, most of these folks flit by with little to do: Brian Dennehy and Dianne Wiest as Brad's parents, Anjelica Huston as a salty sea captain, Tim Blake Nelson as an awestruck birder. It's easy enough to enjoy this film for its offbeat subject and mild-mannered tone, even if there isn't anything terribly distinctive about it.", '--Robert Horton']
{'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'David Frankel, Steve Martin, Owen Wilson, Jack Black', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 40 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.4 x 7.5 inches; 0.8 Ounces', 'Item model number': '25148863', 'Director': 'David Frankel', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 40 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 31, 2012', 'Actors': 'Steve Martin, Jack Black, Owen Wilson', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, English', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Number of discs': '1'}
When I saw this movie the first thing I thought was "this is an actual thing? People do this?"  I had no idea birders took their hobby so seriously.  One of the funniest movies I've seen.
So underrated

The show is a little bit campy, but I think that's just because it's British.  Very good show overall, looking forward to the next seasons.
New Whovian.
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Interests**: The user enjoys *comedy films* and *British shows*, particularly those with offbeat subject matter and unique hobbies (e.g., birdwatching).
- **Preferred Themes**: Exhibits a penchant for *humorous takes* on niche activities; appreciates lighthearted narratives that explore lesser-known passions and subcultures, with a recent interest in *campy, British storytelling*.
- **Content Preference**: Favors movies and shows that blend *comedy with heartfelt moments*, appreciating both humor and entertainment value, even if character depth may not be substantially explored.
- **Ratings**: Tends to give *high ratings (4.5-5 stars)* to films and shows that provide genuine humor and joy, indicating a positive engagement with content that resonates on a personal or comedic level. Recent engagement reflects a strong endorsement of positive experiences, scoring highly for enjoyable content.
- **Engagement Style**: Shows a tendency for thoughtful reviews reflecting surprise and delight, indicating an open-minded approach to diverse media, including exploring campy narratives.
- **Actors/Directors**: Displays interest in well-known comedic actors and cherished show creators, suggesting a preference for familiar faces that enhance the viewing experience.
- **Overall Attitude**: Approaches media consumption with curiosity and appreciation, enjoying films and shows that challenge typical storytelling norms while offering humor, including those with playful, whimsical elements.
